results.title: Issues in education: the Chief Executive - schooling P-12
results.creator_credit: Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Dr. Graham Allen, Chief Executive, Ministry of Education, explains Victoria’s school curriculum plan for preparatory level to Year 12. The objective is to have the maximum number of students completing Year 12. The curriculum includes a broad education spectrum up to Year 10, with specialized subjects during Years 11-12, enabling astudents to pursue further education or to join the workforce with a knowledge of current technology.
results.title_for_label: Issues in education: the Chief Executive - schooling P-12
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: What about me?: young people and local government
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Katie, a Year 12 student wants to find out more about what her Local City Council can do for her. This program follows her inquiries and shows what she discovers.

results.title: Antigone by Sophocles: a discussion
results.creator_credit: David Zweck and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Dennis Pryor of Melbourne Univeristy and Jenny Webb discuss Sophocles’ play in detail. Characters, themes and backgrounds are explored and illustrated with readings from the play.

results.title: Feet and footwear: caring for your feet
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Thomas is one-year old and is fitted for his first pair of shoes. It is an unhappy experience for him and raises questions regarding why we need footwear and why we need to care for our feet. Two podiatrists, a shoe manufacturer and a shoe retailer/fitter share their knowledge and advice relating to feet and footwear.

results.title: Tirra Lirra by the river [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project, Box Hill School of TAFE
results.brief_description: Jocelyn Terry, Elaine Barry and Greg Kratzman discuss Jessica Anderson novel, which is set in Brisbane. Explores the text’s connection with Tennyson’s poem; Nora’s exploration of her own experience; the role of masks and the place of minor characters.

results.title: The Harp in the South [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Barry Washington and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Ruth Park’s social documentary is the basis for this program hosted by Richard McRoberts. The program attempts to present the background and the setting together with its genesis in Ruth Park’s own life experiences.

results.title: Commitment
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Jocelyn Terry leads a discussion with Laurie Clancy of La Trobe University and Colin Goodwin of the Phillip Institute, in aspects of commitment as revealed in Thomas Keneally’s book “Schindler’s Ark” and in Graham Greene’s book “The Power and the Glory”. Some provocative considerations emerge about the varieties of commitment, motivations for and consequences of commitment, as revealed in these texts.
